intro: Tapiscia yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan tapiscia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
